text:
Russell Marion Nelson (born September 9, 1924) is the 17th and current President of the The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS Church) upon replacing Thomas S. Monson in January 2018. He was a member of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles of the LDS Church. He is also a known cardiothoracic surgeon.
Currently, is the oldest living Mormon apostle.. In July 3, 2015, following the death of President Boyd K. Packer, Nelson became President of the Quorum.

annotations.surface_form: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
